name: A018
content: Automatically extract the information a user or a customer wants from a vast amount of information

name: A079
content: Meet or exceed international product and service standards to overcome barriers to trade and position company as a world class quality supplier

name: A058
content: Expand content about your company, its offers, its achievements, and its affiliations; operate a large data collection and service center; and broaden your product and service portfolio

name: A001
content: A strong top management team must own the scaling culture and model the behavior they want

name: A002
content: Access resources required to scale at relatively low cost or for free by creating benefits for the resource owners that they cannot create alone

name: A003
content: Adapt products and services to each market

name: A004
content: Advance products and services

name: A005
content: Align interests of investors, the company top management team, and its owners

name: A006
content: Allow individuals and organizations to make money using your products and services

name: A007
content: Apply big data analytics to produce information about users, suppliers and customers and suggest questions

name: A008
content: Apply digital technology to brand, market, sell, and service customers more cost effectively than competitors

name: A009
content: Apply processes that continuously improve the cybersecurity of the company as well as its offers, channels and resources

name: A010
content: Apply processes that make products and services easier to understand, produce and deliver

name: A011
content: Appoint a talented individual as the company Chief Scale Officer to champion scaling initiatives

name: A012
content: Arrange and apply differently the company existing resources

name: A013
content: Arrange and apply resources from different regions early, rapidly and securely

name: A014
content: Assimilate what companies that scale early, rapidly and securely do, and apply it

name: A015
content: Attain positions in interorganizational networks which give access to privileged information

name: A016
content: Attain stakeholder trust by improving cybersecurity of the company and the players it works with

name: A017
content: Automate the existing processes that add the most benefits to customers and require the most human intervention

name: A019
content: Balance and align scale objectives set for the near, mid and long term

name: A020
content: Be responsible and accountable for creating and making visible the quantifiable benefits the company delivers its stakeholders, including customers, partners, investors, members of the company value chain, society, and others

name: A021
content: Build a scaling master plan on a combination of resources that is hard to replicate

name: A022
content: Build and deploy unique and difficult to imitate skills and capabilities to select, combine, and use the resource combinations that create and capture high company value

name: A023
content: Build capability to operate across borders early

name: A024
content: Build company wide capability to combine diverse resources and deploy

name: A025
content: Build internet based capabilities to acquire and retain customers during the initial stages of company development

name: A026
content: Champion the opportunity with confidence

name: A027
content: Combine resources that make your company distinct to resource owners and pay for themselves

name: A028
content: Combine two or more resources in a way that the value created from them exceeds the sum of the value created from each resource separately

name: A029
content: Combine your company resources with the resources of other organizations to create value that cannot be created by your company working alone

name: A030
content: Communicate and demonstrate the importance the company places on the security of information acquired from and transferred between stakeholders

name: A031
content: Concurrently improve the offers to your customers, investors and other resource owners as well as in the mechanisms required to scale

name: A032
content: Concurrently sell the company existing products and services, a compelling image of the company that will exist in the future, and the benefits of the unique data that you collect

name: A033
content: Continuously improve company cybersecurity by i) Assessment of cyber risks to company (Risk analysis); ii) Implementation of cybersecurity measures (Protect); iii) Rapid identification and resonse to cyberattacks (Monitor); and iv) Reduction of cyberattack impact (Respond)

name: A034
content: Continuously improve individuals and operations to deliver a portfolio of innovative products and services

name: A035
content: Continuously improve the user interfaces and applications that directly influence the entirety of the customer experience including personalized content, quality messaging, and the delivery and returns process

name: A036
content: Continuously improve value propositions based on results and feedback

name: A037
content: Continuously seek and receive funding to support the company scaling master plan and improve its brand in the marketplace

name: A038
content: Continuously train individuals in cybersecurity so as to i) Improve cybersecurity operations; and ii) Positively contribute to the company's cybersecurity culture

name: A039
content: Continuously use customer feedback to support rapid product iterations

name: A040
content: Dedicate teams with strong mix of marketing and technical skills

name: A041
content: Define the ideal target customers profiles and engage them relentlessly

name: A042
content: Deliver products and services that offer convenience, cater to customer demands, are secure and offer excellent customer experience

name: A043
content: Develop a compelling image of your future company and use it to convince investors to provide the funding and resource owners to provide the resources the company requires to scale

name: A044
content: Develop and implement a governance model to scale, raise capital, protect against the unauthorized use of electronic resources, and leverage business ecosystems

name: A045
content: Develop and sell products and services that address a problem, job to be done or a need that is widespread, growing, important, urgent, and manifests itself in diverse ways

name: A046
content: Develop and sell products and services that are hard to replicate, original, fit commercialization patterns known to be successful, and ride an external trend

name: A047
content: Develop capabilities to cost effectively attain scaling objectives

name: A048
content: Develop data analytic, cybersecurity, entrepreneurial, and technology related skills at all levels

name: A049
content: Develop value propositions for each investor and resource owner with three components: i) What benefits your company provides; ii) What you want in return; and iii) Why they should choose your offer instead of alternatives

name: A050
content: Eliminate communication and coordination barriers when working with foreign partners that are geographically separate, institutionally distant, and operate in different time zones

name: A051
content: Embed and operate in foreign markets: i) work with locals and help them succeed, ii) adjust offers to meet local needs, iii) target customer segments that are different than those targeted in home country, iv) use internet to market and promote offers to locals, and v) develop relationships with leaders in communities with information and resources that are important to succeeding in foreign market

name: A052
content: Enable locals to succeed because of new company

name: A053
content: Enable power users to help improve the company products and services using the internet

name: A054
content: Enable users to participate in the rapid development of company products and services

name: A055
content: Enforce policies and procedures for resource combination, production and coordination, information search and gathering, bargaining, and accountability

name: A056
content: Enter a new market by partnering with or purchasing local companies

name: A057
content: Expand brand coverage, eliminate intermediaries, and operate a platform that is simple to use, attracts a very large market, and enables the company to control the quality of the products traded on the platform

name: A059
content: Find, attract, develop, and reward talented people who have access to a broad portfolio of experts from various disciplines, discover connections across disciplines, and combine insights from different disciplines

name: A060
content: First leverage channels comprised of ecommerce platforms, then sell directly, and then sell using agents

name: A061
content: Focus your scaling master plan on your decisions about selecting, combining and deploying the resources that will create high value, as well as the decisions on how the value created will be distributed to the individuals and organizations that provided the resources

name: A062
content: Hire talented people who have diverse thinking preferences

name: A063
content: Hire talented people with experience performing the roles required to scale as well as developing the company specific capabilities required to scale

name: A064
content: Hire, develop and partner with talented people who have experience scaling companies, many connections and good reputations

name: A065
content: Improve links, interactions and shared purpose with local organizations in each region the company operates

name: A066
content: Incorporate cybersecurity in value propositions

name: A067
content: Incorporate cybersecurity investment into scaling master plan

name: A068
content: Invest in company cybersecurity that improves cybersecurity of all members of the company value chain

name: A069
content: Lead a team that is innovative, talented, diverse, focused, committed, and fully understands what their responsibilities are and where they fit in with scaling the business

name: A070
content: Learn to make well reasoned decisions or conclusions about how to scale from own experience and others

name: A071
content: Leverage online and offline communities

name: A072
content: Leverage resources from talented people who have scaling experience and knowledge

name: A073
content: Maintain close relationships with the individuals and organizations that advance the development and application of the core technology upon which your most important assets depend

name: A074
content: Maintain connections with large and varied investor networks

name: A075
content: Make decisions on how to best deploy a combination of external and internal resources to create high value, not just decisions about the use of the resources the company owns, while complying with cultural, legal, regulatory, and other relevant norms

name: A076
content: Make increasing the spread between the price customers are willing to pay for an offer and the cost of producing and delivering the offer the company top scaling objective

name: A077
content: Make the definition and implementation of the scaling master plan the top company priority

name: A078
content: Manage cross border units as operations that are interdependent in terms of information, funding and efficiencies and guided by a coordinated strategy

name: A080
content: Offer a variety of complementary products and services to each market

name: A081
content: Offer investors higher returns, shorter time to payoffs and lower risk relative to other opportunities available to them

name: A082
content: Offer rewards that satisfy customer needs for recognition of their loyalty

name: A083
content: Operate in regions with strong cybersecurity policy and legal frameworks

name: A084
content: Operate systems of coordination, evaluation, and knowledge sharing between headquarters and regional units and among the units themselves

name: A085
content: Optimize the value chain to reduce inventory costs to zero

name: A086
content: Orchestrate a community comprised of the owners of the resources required to scale

name: A087
content: Pay more attention to online sales than to physical brick and mortar store sales relative to competitors

name: A088
content: Perpetuate a company culture of scaling based on a strongly held and widely shared set of beliefs that include high growth ambitions, delivering new benefits to customers, embedding in ecosystems led by fast growth companies, keeping the company and those it works with secure from cyberattacks, attracting investment, exceeding high standards, continuous improvement, experimentation, iteration, learning, and short feedback loops

name: A089
content: Prepare a scaling master plan in the initial stages of the life cycle of your company

name: A090
content: Provide evidence that supports why customers, investors, and resource owners should believe the company will be able to deliver on its value propositions

name: A091
content: Provide returns that leaves the most important owners of resources better off than they would have been had they not contributed to the company

name: A092
content: Relentlessly advance the scaling master plan even if employees and processes get in the way

name: A093
content: Scale out, i.e., i) Spread workload across more, smaller organizations; ii) Use less expensive resources to accommodate variable workloads; iii) Host data across several organizations; iv) Increase input-output alignment; v) Learn faster; vi) Take advantage of cheaper, smaller systems; and vi) Improve resilience

name: A094
content: Scale up, i.e., i) Upgrade capacity of existing scale model that works; ii) Automate and self serve; iii) Make  no substantial change to scale model; iv) Reduce administrative efforts; v) Take advantage of cost effective and efficient technology;  and vi) Outsource what others can do better

name: A095
content: Sell high quality products at lower prices compared to competitors

name: A096
content: Sell online using a variety of online and offline promotional channels

name: A097
content: Sell products and services that the target market perceives to be better than available alternatives

name: A098
content: Shape ethical behavior for all business activities

name: A099
content: Simultaneously develop worldwide learning capabilities, multinational flexibility, and global competitiveness

name: A100
content: Specify the kinds of innovation that are important for the company  (e.g., technological capabilities that are hard to imitate, business model innovation, rapid routine innovation), how the innovation will create value for customers and how the company will capture part of the value created as revenue

name: A101
content: Standardize processes

name: A102
content: Strengthen cybersecurity attributes of products and services compared to competitors

name: A103
content: Strengthen your company bargaining position among the members of the value chain upon which the company depends to scale

name: A104
content: The top management team must commit to a scaling master plan (strategy), a hierarchy and a flow of communications external and internal to the company (structure), and a set of behaviors (culture) to achieve scaling objectives

name: A105
content: Upgrade products by incorporating a new technology that satisfies a popular trend

name: A106
content: Use an end to end solution that links procurement directly with end customers to eliminate or reduce inventory and the number of intermediaries between the company and customers

name: A107
content: Use physical brick and mortar stores to allow customers to try out products before buying, but use the Internet to make bulk of sales

name: A108
content: Use scientific and technological advances to develop innovative products and services

name: A109
content: Use trusted cross border platforms which enable payments, refunds, logistics, data analytics and offer localization

name: A110
content: Validate how the decisions about selecting, combining and deploying the resources required to scale complement each other

name: A111
content: When you ask investors for money, clearly articulate: i) Why you need the money; ii) What amount you need; iii) What you are promising to return and under what conditions; iv) What you are going to do with the money to create returns for investors; and v) your governance model and the names and biographies of the people who sit on your Board of Directors and your Board of Advisors

name: A112
content: Work with individuals and organizations that are well connected and respected in the networks which are important for the success of the company

name: A113
content: Offer benefits to customers, investors and other key stakeholders that are important, differentiated from, and superior to, competing offerings

name: A114
content: Develop value propositions that enhance your customers and suppliers outcomes, marketing strategies, and competitive advantages

name: A115
content: Incorporate elements of value into your value propositions to consumers that address four kinds of needs - functional, emotional, life changing, and social impact.

name: A116
content: Integrate environmental, economic, and social aspects of value into the value propositions for your key stakeholders

name: A117
content: Deliver high value to customers before, during, and after they use your company products or consume your company services

name: A118
content: Develop value propositions for employees that enhance employee satisfaction, psychological attachment, and behavioral commitment toward your company

name: A119
content: The required investment and the resulting most significant stakeholder benefits should be quantified in specific, measurable, attainable, relevant and time-bound terms

name: A120
content: Align value propositions for customers, investors and other stakeholders in a way that they support, agree with and reinforce each other

name: A121
content: Develop value propositions for those who pay, not just those who benefit

name: A122
content: Develop value propositions that support or agree with the value proposition of key members of the company value chain as well as improve the competences of the supply chain

name: A123
content: Continuously find new and innovative ways to offer value to customers in existing and new markets

name: A124
content: Continuously create new markets and serve broader stakeholder needs

name: A125
content: Align investor value propositions with company scale objectives so they are mutually reinforcing rather than conflicting

name: A126
content: Recognize what new companies that are scaling rapidly do, assimilate the lessons learned, and apply them to develop and implement your company value propositions

name: A127
content: Learn from value propositions of companies that have grown early, rapidly and securely and apply them to differentiate your company

name: A128
content: To align the value propositions for customers, investors, and resource owners, make explicit the benefits: (i) an investor gains by the presence of the customer and resource owner, (ii) a customer gains by the presence of the investor and the resource owner, and (iii) the resource owner gains by the presence of the customer and the investors

name: A129
content: To align value propositions for customers, investors, and resource owners, co-create a unique combination of resources that did not previously exist

name: A130
content: To align value propositions to all relevant stakeholders, develop an objective that benefits them all

name: A131
content: Track changes in stakeholders value propositions over time and use the information to align them

name: A132
content: Conduct detailed due diligence when selecting investors

name: A133
content: Find investors appropriate to company industry, risk, product introduction, timeframe, and return profile

name: A134
content: Raise capital in stages to reduce dilution and maximize risk-adjusted prices for investors

name: A135
content: Align communication with investors on company risks, opportunities, and economics for successful fundraising rounds

name: A136
content: Increase investor participation by effectively managing regulatory uncertainty

name: A137
content: Provide investors with long-term liquidity to enable distribution of funds to their capital providers

name: A138
content: Implement a stakeholder centric approach to satisfy stakeholders' expectations in all markets

name: A139
content: On entering new markets, deploy digital infrastructures capable of servicing scaleable customer bases and reconfigures compute resources allocated based upon demand

name: A140
content: Continuously improve company and value chain fulfillment and logistics capabilities to satisfy scaling objectives, high quality standards and minimize delivery delays

name: A141
content: Collaborate with the company value chain to determine optimal product and services offerings that achieve customer fulfillment and enhance company value

name: A142
content: Work with partners that can Implement flexible automation for small batch production to satisfy customers
